definition: balsam/Balsaminaceae (a flower family including Impatiens balsamina)/touch-me-not/busy Lizzie
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Yonder is my house, by the hedge of flowering henna ;
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕，前面盛開着鳳仙花的籬邊，就是我的家。

sentences.english: There are also annuals, primarily impatiens, that bloom in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 而一年生植物鳳仙花綻放在陰影出。

sentences.english: The characteristic that this planting is petaline open and flat, unlike other balsamine.
sentences.chinese: 本種的特點爲花瓣平展，不同於其它鳳仙花。

sentences.english: In the insect pest of balsamine , the mainest is mite, the red spider that often says namely.
sentences.chinese: 在鳳仙花的蟲害中，最主要的是蟎，即常說的紅蜘蛛。

sentences.english: Yonder is my house, by the hedge of flowering henna ; I will guide you.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕，前面盛開着鳳仙花的籬邊，就是我的家。

sentences.english: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.
sentences.chinese: 我以我的良人爲一棵鳳仙花，在隱基底的葡萄園中。

sentences.english: Some of the most popular bedding flowers are chrysanthemums, impatiens and petunias.
sentences.chinese: 一些最受歡迎的花有菊花，鳳仙花和喇叭花。

sentences.english: Why might balsam be described as impatient?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼說鳳仙花“急不可待”？

sentences.english: They planted some garden balsams in the backyard .
sentences.chinese: 他們在後院裏種了些鳳仙花。

definition: to lose color/to turn pale/to bleach/to fade
